v3DependencyOptimization.description: Optimized dependency chain for maximum parallel execution efficiency

originalDependencies.description: Current dependency chain with blocking issues
issues: Some agents wait unnecessarily for unrelated dependencies
Phase boundaries too rigid, reducing parallelism
Agent #11 and #12 have excessive blocking dependencies

optimizedDependencies.description: Enhanced parallel execution with reduced blocking

parallel_groups.description: Security agents run in full parallel
Core architect starts immediately with security
TDD engineer starts early for framework setup
Core implementation agents start after architect
MCP specialist works in parallel with core
Queen starts once security baseline + architecture ready

phase3_enhanced.name: Enhanced Integration (Weeks 5-9)
phase3_enhanced.description: Reduced blocking dependencies for integration agents

parallel_groups.description: Integration architect needs only core arch + memory
CLI developer needs only core architecture (reduced from [5,10])
Neural developer needs only core architecture (reduced from [7,10])

phase4_enhanced.name: Enhanced Polish & Release (Weeks 9-16)
phase4_enhanced.description: Final optimization with all agents active

parallel_groups.description: Release engineer waits for testing + performance validation
All agents perform final optimization in parallel

reducedBlockingDependencies.description: Specific dependency reductions to enable better parallelism

changes.rationale: CLI can be modernized with just core architecture, integration can happen later
Neural learning can start with core architecture, memory/integration can be added incrementally
Queen should wait for security baseline and core architecture before orchestrating
changes.coordination_benefit: More intelligent coordination with foundation in place

phaseBoundaryOptimization.description: Flexible phase boundaries to maximize parallel efficiency

rules.description: Phases can overlap by 50% once foundation requirements are met
rules.example: Phase 2 core systems can start in week 2 while Phase 1 security continues

flexibility_rules.action: Start next phase critical agents early
Reassign free agents to unblocked work

riskMitigation.description: Risk management for optimized dependency chain

strategies.risk: Early agent starts without sufficient foundation
Coordination overhead with more parallel agents
strategies.mitigation: Queen coordinator with enhanced GitHub integration

tooling.dependency_tracker: GitHub project boards with agent assignments
tooling.coordination: Queen coordinator with MCP orchestration tools

efficiency.measurement: Time agents spend on productive work vs waiting

timeline.target: 16 weeks total (vs 20 weeks with original dependencies)

coordination.measurement: Time from blocker identification to resolution

quality.target: No degradation in output quality due to rushed dependencies
quality.measurement: Test coverage and review completion rates
